summary: An FBI 302 interview summary from January 10, 2020, documenting that an individual stated she was sexually trafficked in September 2006 and abused on Jeffrey Epstein's island. The individual also claimed that Lesley Groff, an unnamed person, and Ghislaine Maxwell all ruined her life. The interview was not completed, but the individual is willing to meet in the future.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the individual whose island was the location where the interviewee stated she was abused.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Named by the interviewee as one of the individuals who 'ruined her life'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named by the interviewee as one of the individuals who 'ruined her life'.

connections.description: Both are implicated by the interviewee in the context of sexual abuse and trafficking.
Groff is named alongside Maxwell in the context of ruining the interviewee's life, connecting her to Epstein's activities.
Both are named together by the interviewee as individuals who ruined her life.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Trafficking and Abuse
events.description: The interviewee stated she was sexually trafficked and abused on Jeffrey Epstein's island.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: An FBI interview was conducted with an individual who made allegations of sexual trafficking and abuse. The interview was not completed, but the individual is willing to meet in the future.

keyFacts: An individual stated she was sexually trafficked in or about September 2006.
The individual stated she was abused on Jeffrey Epstein's island.
The individual claimed that Lesley Groff, another unnamed person, and Ghislaine Maxwell 'all ruined her life'.
The interview was not completed, but the individual is willing to meet for a full interview at a future date.
The document is an FBI 302 form, indicating it is a summary of an investigative interview.
